curam.util.security
Class Authorisation

java.lang.Object
  curam.util.security.Authorisation

public final class Authorisation
extends java.lang.Object

The Authorization class provides the application with access to the Security Identifier elements that are necessary for the application to build it's own authorization on top of that offered by the infrastructure.

Method Summary

Method Detail

getSecurityNamesByType

public static StringList getSecurityNamesByType(java.lang.String sidType)
                                         throws AppException,
                                                InformationalException
Return a list of Security Identifier names that have the specified security identifier type. This consults the database rather than the cache.

Parameters:
sidType - the security identifier type for which to return the list of security identifier names (e.g. PRODUCT, FIELD, or FUNCTION)
Returns:
The list of security identifier names based on the security identifier type, an empty list if no identifiers can be discovered.
Throws:
AppException - Typical Database Exception.
InformationalException - Generic Exception Signature.

isSIDAuthorised

public static boolean isSIDAuthorised(java.lang.String aSid,
                                      java.lang.String userName)
                               throws AppRuntimeException,
                                      AppException,
                                      InformationalException
Determine if the username specified has access to a named security identifier. This consults the cache as opposed to the database. A security identifier is an arbitrary name to which a user may be granted access. Authorization check failures will be logged to the database and log file by default, due to the fact that this method calls the overloaded isSIDAuthorised(final String aSid, final String userName, final boolean logFailures) passing true as the value for logFailures.

Parameters:
aSid - a security identifier
userName - the userName to authorize
Returns:
True if the userName has access to the security identifier specified.
Throws:
AppRuntimeException - RUN_ID_SECURITY_CACHE_OPEN_FAILURE - if the SecurityCache failed to open.
AppException - generic exception signature
InformationalException - generic exception signature
See Also:
Authorisation.isSIDAuthorised(String, String, boolean)

isSIDAuthorised

public static boolean isSIDAuthorised(java.lang.String aSid,
                                      java.lang.String userName,
                                      boolean logFailures)
                               throws AppRuntimeException,
                                      AppException,
                                      InformationalException
Determine if the username specified has access to a named security identifier. This consults the cache as opposed to the database. A security identifier is an arbitrary name to which a user may be granted access. In this overloaded isSIDAuthorised authorization check failure logging will be disabled if the boolean logFailures argument is false.

Parameters:
aSid - a security identifier
userName - the userName to authorize
logFailures - when this switch is true authorization check failures will be logged to the database and log file
Returns:
True if the userName has access to the security identifier specified.
Throws:
AppRuntimeException - RUN_ID_SECURITY_CACHE_OPEN_FAILURE - if the SecurityCache failed to open.
AppException - generic exception signature
InformationalException - generic exception signature
